comment: Professor Como was really helpful. Lectures are pretty good. Go to class he always gives out study questions for the test but you have to show up to get them. Four exams he drops your lowest score. So pass the first three  and exempt the final. Definitely recommend him.

This is the best prof to take for this class.  He does know this stuff, but he def knows finance better.  The testing and homework structure is the same as his finance class.  You have to be there to pass this class.  You also have to study or know linear programming, ANOVA, or regression really well.  Very good experience in this class.

Finance was a great class!  You have to attend because the homework system will make or break you.  Homework is random and you do not know when it is coming.  You can tell his knowledge is far advanced than the class material, but he is good with talking about finance.  3 tests total with study guides.  Take Him.  He's sarcastic and funny.

He was hilarious and made the subject easier to understand.  He curves all of his tests. On one test, the lowest grade was a 73. Definitely would take again. The only downside is that he gives out random homework.  He was a great professor.

Como is hilarious and keeps things interesting when he can. Some of the material is just plain dry if you don't enjoy math. However, if you actually do the homework assignments (random pickup) and ask questions, he WILL help and explain better. He's helpful one-on-one more so than in class, though. He's better at teaching finance, but not bad here.

So far he has been clear with email communications and answering questions. Willing to answer questions in office. Lectures are somewhat confusing but he keeps it interesting. Hilarious sense of humor I enjoyed his class

A lot of sarcasm but he is very invested and sincerely wants you to understand the material, very helpful if you ask for help, spends a lot of time perfecting his delivery making sure that everything is useful and clear. Come to every class and you will have a good grade, do the homework and you will get A, he grades the tests very generously.

He was awesome! I hate econ and anything math-related and I loved his class. He made it very easy to understand. You have to work for it but we go to school to work so as long as you know that you should be fine. Doesn't take attendance but you miss a lot if you don't go.
Professor Como is very easy to understand and helps a lot in class.  His tests are TF and multiple choice.  Homework counted as a test grade but he only takes up 510 and grades 4 of them.

Great professor! He had me laughing each class and is an enjoyable person! He is also a "No B.S." professor so you HAVE to stay on top of pracitcums and really read! His tests are verbatim what he discusses during "Review" day. Also, final is optional so if you do well for the first 3 tests you can skip  the last month of class!

Take HIM. Professor Como has kind of been bashed on here for his Econ 3300 class, which may deter you from Finance but his class is awesome. He gives out homework randomly and takes some for a grade so you do get stuck going to class even when you aren't in the mood. He is hilarious though and keeps you connected through his humor.

Easy class, easy A; took this course during Summer Semester, 4 Tests - lowest grade was dropped, no Final, MC Questions, read the chapters from the book and do the Practicums and you will be just fine; very helpful Professor
Favorite Professor thus far at Kennesaw. Lively lecture, with humor and real experiences perfectly infused. MC Tests, no attendance.

This is a tough subject all together. He warned us the first day it is a "Weed out" class. He works with you to an extent, but will not give you the answers. Curves. Not too bad really, just a really tough subject. Study the book as much as possible and keep up with it. If I didn't fall a week behind, I would have made an A.

Why did Coles hire him? Do not take him if you actually want to learn something. Come to every class because he hands out random practicums that determine a large part of your grade. However, coming to every class doesn't mean you'll learn anything. The book won't help either because he doesn't follow it and his PowerPoints have several errors.

He is the WORST teacher I've ever taken!! There is a lot of math involved and he doesn't know how to explain it at all! He hardly gives examples and when he does, there are errors throughout his work. Very confusing! don't take him!!

The only reason to go to class is because he gives out homework randomly. His lectures are scattered and boring and often have many mistakes with the math. Got an A because he takes his test and homeworks from a pdf that can found online. So if you study that you'll be fine.

His verbiage is sometimes difficult to follow. Not too effective delivering the material in his lectures. Homeworks and practicums helped me to prepare for his exams. His exams were not too hard. No attendance policy. Not a hard class if you read your book.

Attendance is measured with HW and practicums that he hands out in class. He is a terrible teacher and I would not recommend anyone take him until he learns to get his teaching styles straight. He knows his stuff, and has experience using it, but teaching it is a completely different story.
